intro: Diapedium khasianum, commonly known as the Khasi diapedium, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
